intro: Cereus laetevirens var. caesius, commonly known as the Blue Ghost Cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of South America. It is a columnar cactus characterized by its smooth, bluish-green stems and sparse, spiny areoles. The plant produces striking, pale blue flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, requiring minimal water to survive. Due to its unique appearance and nocturnal flowering, it is a popular choice for collectors and cactus enthusiasts.
